        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A pinned tab typically can't be placed in a group. However, when using the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts (to move a tab to the previous/next position; only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros), the selected tab will be added to an adjacent group, if there is one. That's true even if the selected tab is pinned.<span class="line"><!---->A pinned tab typically can't be placed in a group. However, when using the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts (to move a tab to the previous/next position; only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros), the selected tab will be added to an adjacent group, if there is one. That's true even if the selected tab is pinned.<!----></span><br><br>An extension with the debugger permission can then use this behavior to produce the same effect as described in <span class="line"><!---->An extension with the debugger permission can then use this behavior to produce the same effect as described in <!----></span>issue 1198717<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1198717" title="Security: OOB write after extension pins tab during drag"><!---->issue 1198717<!----></a> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>issue 1209469<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1209469" title="Security: OOB write after creating pinned tab that's also in a group"><!---->issue 1209469<!----></a>. Specifically, moving the group will also move the pinned tab, breaking the constraint that pinned tabs are always at the start of the tab strip. Then, attempting to move the pinned tab to a different index will result in an out-of-bounds write in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->. Specifically, moving the group will also move the pinned tab, breaking the constraint that pinned tabs are always at the start of the tab strip. Then, attempting to move the pinned tab to a different index will result in an out-of-bounds write in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 92.0.4513.0 (latest asan build)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 92.0.4513.0 (latest asan build)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Install the attached extension.<span class="line"><!---->1. Install the attached extension.<!----></span><br>2. Once installed, the extension will create a window with two tabs and add one of those tabs to a group.<span class="line"><!---->2. Once installed, the extension will create a window with two tabs and add one of those tabs to a group.<!----></span><br>3. It will then create a pinned tab, attach the debugger to it and use Input.dispatchKeyEvent to dispatch the Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcut to it. As the pinned tab is located directly before the tab that was grouped, the pinned tab will be added to that group.<span class="line"><!---->3. It will then create a pinned tab, attach the debugger to it and use Input.dispatchKeyEvent to dispatch the Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcut to it. As the pinned tab is located directly before the tab that was grouped, the pinned tab will be added to that group.<!----></span><br>4. The extension will then call chrome.tabGroups.move to move the group to the end of the tab strip. This will also move the pinned tab, meaning that there's now a pinned tab that's not at the start of the tab strip.<span class="line"><!---->4. The extension will then call chrome.tabGroups.move to move the group to the end of the tab strip. This will also move the pinned tab, meaning that there's now a pinned tab that's not at the start of the tab strip.<!----></span><br>5. Finally, the extension will use chrome.tabs.move to move the pinned tab to index 0. This will result in an OOB write in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->5. Finally, the extension will use chrome.tabs.move to move the pinned tab to index 0. This will result in an OOB write in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: David Erceg<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: David Erceg<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The core issue here is that TabStripModel::MoveTabRelative doesn't check whether a tab is pinned when determining whether it should be added to an adjacent group:<span class="line"><!---->The core issue here is that TabStripModel::MoveTabRelative doesn't check whether a tab is pinned when determining whether it should be added to an adjacent group:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a<!----></a><br><br>Also, as stated in the summary, the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts are only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros:<span class="line"><!---->Also, as stated in the summary, the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts are only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf<!----></a><br><br>So this issue is only relevant on those platforms.<span class="line"><!---->So this issue is only relevant on those platforms.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1210985#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      sheriffbot<a id="user-link" href="/u/1950284618" title="sheriffbot"><!---->sheriffbot<!----></a>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1210985#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sat, May 22, 2021, 1:27 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1210985#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sat, May 22, 2021, 1:27 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Pri-3 Pri-1
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Pri-3 Pri-1
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: M92's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: M92's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: govind@(Android), benmason@(iOS), dgagnon@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind@(Android), benmason@(iOS), dgagnon@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

    <mr-migrated-banner hidden=""></mr-migrated-banner>
            <div class="issue-header-container">
              <mr-issue-header></mr-issue-header>

        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A pinned tab typically can't be placed in a group. However, when using the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts (to move a tab to the previous/next position; only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros), the selected tab will be added to an adjacent group, if there is one. That's true even if the selected tab is pinned.<span class="line"><!---->A pinned tab typically can't be placed in a group. However, when using the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts (to move a tab to the previous/next position; only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros), the selected tab will be added to an adjacent group, if there is one. That's true even if the selected tab is pinned.<!----></span><br><br>An extension with the debugger permission can then use this behavior to produce the same effect as described in <span class="line"><!---->An extension with the debugger permission can then use this behavior to produce the same effect as described in <!----></span>issue 1198717<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1198717" title="Security: OOB write after extension pins tab during drag"><!---->issue 1198717<!----></a> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>issue 1209469<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1209469" title="Security: OOB write after creating pinned tab that's also in a group"><!---->issue 1209469<!----></a>. Specifically, moving the group will also move the pinned tab, breaking the constraint that pinned tabs are always at the start of the tab strip. Then, attempting to move the pinned tab to a different index will result in an out-of-bounds write in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->. Specifically, moving the group will also move the pinned tab, breaking the constraint that pinned tabs are always at the start of the tab strip. Then, attempting to move the pinned tab to a different index will result in an out-of-bounds write in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 92.0.4513.0 (latest asan build)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 92.0.4513.0 (latest asan build)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Install the attached extension.<span class="line"><!---->1. Install the attached extension.<!----></span><br>2. Once installed, the extension will create a window with two tabs and add one of those tabs to a group.<span class="line"><!---->2. Once installed, the extension will create a window with two tabs and add one of those tabs to a group.<!----></span><br>3. It will then create a pinned tab, attach the debugger to it and use Input.dispatchKeyEvent to dispatch the Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcut to it. As the pinned tab is located directly before the tab that was grouped, the pinned tab will be added to that group.<span class="line"><!---->3. It will then create a pinned tab, attach the debugger to it and use Input.dispatchKeyEvent to dispatch the Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcut to it. As the pinned tab is located directly before the tab that was grouped, the pinned tab will be added to that group.<!----></span><br>4. The extension will then call chrome.tabGroups.move to move the group to the end of the tab strip. This will also move the pinned tab, meaning that there's now a pinned tab that's not at the start of the tab strip.<span class="line"><!---->4. The extension will then call chrome.tabGroups.move to move the group to the end of the tab strip. This will also move the pinned tab, meaning that there's now a pinned tab that's not at the start of the tab strip.<!----></span><br>5. Finally, the extension will use chrome.tabs.move to move the pinned tab to index 0. This will result in an OOB write in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->5. Finally, the extension will use chrome.tabs.move to move the pinned tab to index 0. This will result in an OOB write in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: David Erceg<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: David Erceg<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The core issue here is that TabStripModel::MoveTabRelative doesn't check whether a tab is pinned when determining whether it should be added to an adjacent group:<span class="line"><!---->The core issue here is that TabStripModel::MoveTabRelative doesn't check whether a tab is pinned when determining whether it should be added to an adjacent group:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a<!----></a><br><br>Also, as stated in the summary, the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts are only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros:<span class="line"><!---->Also, as stated in the summary, the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts are only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf<!----></a><br><br>So this issue is only relevant on those platforms.<span class="line"><!---->So this issue is only relevant on those platforms.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity High. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: M92's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: M92's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: govind@(Android), benmason@(iOS), dgagnon@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind@(Android), benmason@(iOS), dgagnon@(ChromeOS), srinivassista@(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1210985: Security: OOB write after moving pinned tab into a group
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1210985: Security: OOB write after moving pinned tab into a group
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      derce...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/773975515" title="derce...@gmail.com"><!---->derce...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      derce...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->derce...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Wed, May 19, 2021, 2:02 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, May 19, 2021, 2:02 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Wed, May 19, 2021, 2:02 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1210985: Security: OOB write after moving pinned tab into a group
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Wed, May 19, 2021, 2:02 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1210985: Security: OOB write after moving pinned tab into a group
          </h1>

        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1210985: Security: OOB write after moving pinned tab into a group

        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      </option>

        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A pinned tab typically can't be placed in a group. However, when using the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts (to move a tab to the previous/next position; only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros), the selected tab will be added to an adjacent group, if there is one. That's true even if the selected tab is pinned.<span class="line"><!---->A pinned tab typically can't be placed in a group. However, when using the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts (to move a tab to the previous/next position; only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros), the selected tab will be added to an adjacent group, if there is one. That's true even if the selected tab is pinned.<!----></span><br><br>An extension with the debugger permission can then use this behavior to produce the same effect as described in <span class="line"><!---->An extension with the debugger permission can then use this behavior to produce the same effect as described in <!----></span>issue 1198717<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1198717" title="Security: OOB write after extension pins tab during drag"><!---->issue 1198717<!----></a> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>issue 1209469<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1209469" title="Security: OOB write after creating pinned tab that's also in a group"><!---->issue 1209469<!----></a>. Specifically, moving the group will also move the pinned tab, breaking the constraint that pinned tabs are always at the start of the tab strip. Then, attempting to move the pinned tab to a different index will result in an out-of-bounds write in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->. Specifically, moving the group will also move the pinned tab, breaking the constraint that pinned tabs are always at the start of the tab strip. Then, attempting to move the pinned tab to a different index will result in an out-of-bounds write in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 92.0.4513.0 (latest asan build)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 92.0.4513.0 (latest asan build)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Install the attached extension.<span class="line"><!---->1. Install the attached extension.<!----></span><br>2. Once installed, the extension will create a window with two tabs and add one of those tabs to a group.<span class="line"><!---->2. Once installed, the extension will create a window with two tabs and add one of those tabs to a group.<!----></span><br>3. It will then create a pinned tab, attach the debugger to it and use Input.dispatchKeyEvent to dispatch the Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcut to it. As the pinned tab is located directly before the tab that was grouped, the pinned tab will be added to that group.<span class="line"><!---->3. It will then create a pinned tab, attach the debugger to it and use Input.dispatchKeyEvent to dispatch the Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcut to it. As the pinned tab is located directly before the tab that was grouped, the pinned tab will be added to that group.<!----></span><br>4. The extension will then call chrome.tabGroups.move to move the group to the end of the tab strip. This will also move the pinned tab, meaning that there's now a pinned tab that's not at the start of the tab strip.<span class="line"><!---->4. The extension will then call chrome.tabGroups.move to move the group to the end of the tab strip. This will also move the pinned tab, meaning that there's now a pinned tab that's not at the start of the tab strip.<!----></span><br>5. Finally, the extension will use chrome.tabs.move to move the pinned tab to index 0. This will result in an OOB write in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->5. Finally, the extension will use chrome.tabs.move to move the pinned tab to index 0. This will result in an OOB write in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: David Erceg<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: David Erceg<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1210985#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, May 19, 2021, 2:07 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The core issue here is that TabStripModel::MoveTabRelative doesn't check whether a tab is pinned when determining whether it should be added to an adjacent group:<span class="line"><!---->The core issue here is that TabStripModel::MoveTabRelative doesn't check whether a tab is pinned when determining whether it should be added to an adjacent group:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a<!----></a><br><br>Also, as stated in the summary, the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts are only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros:<span class="line"><!---->Also, as stated in the summary, the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts are only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf<!----></a><br><br>So this issue is only relevant on those platforms.<span class="line"><!---->So this issue is only relevant on those platforms.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        As described in <span class="line"><!---->As described in <!----></span>#c2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->#c2<!----></a> the core issue is that TabStripModel allows pinned tabs to be moved into a group without being unpinned.<span class="line"><!----> the core issue is that TabStripModel allows pinned tabs to be moved into a group without being unpinned.<!----></span><br><br>Routing to Charlene who worked on dragging into groups and dragging to pin/unpin, since this seems related. Also tagging Taylor who has related tab strip knowledge.<span class="line"><!---->Routing to Charlene who worked on dragging into groups and dragging to pin/unpin, since this seems related. Also tagging Taylor who has related tab strip knowledge.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products.         This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A pinned tab typically can't be placed in a group. However, when using the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts (to move a tab to the previous/next position; only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros), the selected tab will be added to an adjacent group, if there is one. That's true even if the selected tab is pinned.<span class="line"><!---->A pinned tab typically can't be placed in a group. However, when using the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts (to move a tab to the previous/next position; only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros), the selected tab will be added to an adjacent group, if there is one. That's true even if the selected tab is pinned.<!----></span><br><br>An extension with the debugger permission can then use this behavior to produce the same effect as described in <span class="line"><!---->An extension with the debugger permission can then use this behavior to produce the same effect as described in <!----></span>issue 1198717<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1198717" title="Security: OOB write after extension pins tab during drag"><!---->issue 1198717<!----></a> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>issue 1209469<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1209469" title="Security: OOB write after creating pinned tab that's also in a group"><!---->issue 1209469<!----></a>. Specifically, moving the group will also move the pinned tab, breaking the constraint that pinned tabs are always at the start of the tab strip. Then, attempting to move the pinned tab to a different index will result in an out-of-bounds write in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->. Specifically, moving the group will also move the pinned tab, breaking the constraint that pinned tabs are always at the start of the tab strip. Then, attempting to move the pinned tab to a different index will result in an out-of-bounds write in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 92.0.4513.0 (latest asan build)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 92.0.4513.0 (latest asan build)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Install the attached extension.<span class="line"><!---->1. Install the attached extension.<!----></span><br>2. Once installed, the extension will create a window with two tabs and add one of those tabs to a group.<span class="line"><!---->2. Once installed, the extension will create a window with two tabs and add one of those tabs to a group.<!----></span><br>3. It will then create a pinned tab, attach the debugger to it and use Input.dispatchKeyEvent to dispatch the Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcut to it. As the pinned tab is located directly before the tab that was grouped, the pinned tab will be added to that group.<span class="line"><!---->3. It will then create a pinned tab, attach the debugger to it and use Input.dispatchKeyEvent to dispatch the Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcut to it. As the pinned tab is located directly before the tab that was grouped, the pinned tab will be added to that group.<!----></span><br>4. The extension will then call chrome.tabGroups.move to move the group to the end of the tab strip. This will also move the pinned tab, meaning that there's now a pinned tab that's not at the start of the tab strip.<span class="line"><!---->4. The extension will then call chrome.tabGroups.move to move the group to the end of the tab strip. This will also move the pinned tab, meaning that there's now a pinned tab that's not at the start of the tab strip.<!----></span><br>5. Finally, the extension will use chrome.tabs.move to move the pinned tab to index 0. This will result in an OOB write in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->5. Finally, the extension will use chrome.tabs.move to move the pinned tab to index 0. This will result in an OOB write in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: David Erceg<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: David Erceg<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The core issue here is that TabStripModel::MoveTabRelative doesn't check whether a tab is pinned when determining whether it should be added to an adjacent group:<span class="line"><!---->The core issue here is that TabStripModel::MoveTabRelative doesn't check whether a tab is pinned when determining whether it should be added to an adjacent group:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a<!----></a><br><br>Also, as stated in the summary, the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts are only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros:<span class="line"><!---->Also, as stated in the summary, the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts are only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf<!----></a><br><br>So this issue is only relevant on those platforms.<span class="line"><!---->So this issue is only relevant on those platforms.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

        As described in <span class="line"><!---->As described in <!----></span>#c2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->#c2<!----></a> the core issue is that TabStripModel allows pinned tabs to be moved into a group without being unpinned.<span class="line"><!----> the core issue is that TabStripModel allows pinned tabs to be moved into a group without being unpinned.<!----></span><br><br>Routing to Charlene who worked on dragging into groups and dragging to pin/unpin, since this seems related. Also tagging Taylor who has related tab strip knowledge.<span class="line"><!---->Routing to Charlene who worked on dragging into groups and dragging to pin/unpin, since this seems related.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->

        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by derce...@gmail.com (May 19, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>A pinned tab typically can't be placed in a group. However, when using the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts (to move a tab to the previous/next position; only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros), the selected tab will be added to an adjacent group, if there is one. That's true even if the selected tab is pinned.<span class="line"><!---->A pinned tab typically can't be placed in a group. However, when using the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts (to move a tab to the previous/next position; only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros), the selected tab will be added to an adjacent group, if there is one. That's true even if the selected tab is pinned.<!----></span><br><br>An extension with the debugger permission can then use this behavior to produce the same effect as described in <span class="line"><!---->An extension with the debugger permission can then use this behavior to produce the same effect as described in <!----></span>issue 1198717<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1198717" title="Security: OOB write after extension pins tab during drag"><!---->issue 1198717<!----></a> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>issue 1209469<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1209469" title="Security: OOB write after creating pinned tab that's also in a group"><!---->issue 1209469<!----></a>. Specifically, moving the group will also move the pinned tab, breaking the constraint that pinned tabs are always at the start of the tab strip. Then, attempting to move the pinned tab to a different index will result in an out-of-bounds write in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->. Specifically, moving the group will also move the pinned tab, breaking the constraint that pinned tabs are always at the start of the tab strip. Then, attempting to move the pinned tab to a different index will result in an out-of-bounds write in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 92.0.4513.0 (latest asan build)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 92.0.4513.0 (latest asan build)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Install the attached extension.<span class="line"><!---->1. Install the attached extension.<!----></span><br>2. Once installed, the extension will create a window with two tabs and add one of those tabs to a group.<span class="line"><!---->2. Once installed, the extension will create a window with two tabs and add one of those tabs to a group.<!----></span><br>3. It will then create a pinned tab, attach the debugger to it and use Input.dispatchKeyEvent to dispatch the Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcut to it. As the pinned tab is located directly before the tab that was grouped, the pinned tab will be added to that group.<span class="line"><!---->3. It will then create a pinned tab, attach the debugger to it and use Input.dispatchKeyEvent to dispatch the Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcut to it. As the pinned tab is located directly before the tab that was grouped, the pinned tab will be added to that group.<!----></span><br>4. The extension will then call chrome.tabGroups.move to move the group to the end of the tab strip. This will also move the pinned tab, meaning that there's now a pinned tab that's not at the start of the tab strip.<span class="line"><!---->4. The extension will then call chrome.tabGroups.move to move the group to the end of the tab strip. This will also move the pinned tab, meaning that there's now a pinned tab that's not at the start of the tab strip.<!----></span><br>5. Finally, the extension will use chrome.tabs.move to move the pinned tab to index 0. This will result in an OOB write in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->5. Finally, the extension will use chrome.tabs.move to move the pinned tab to index 0. This will result in an OOB write in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: David Erceg<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: David Erceg<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1210985#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, May 19, 2021, 2:07 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1210985#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, May 19, 2021, 2:07 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The core issue here is that TabStripModel::MoveTabRelative doesn't check whether a tab is pinned when determining whether it should be added to an adjacent group:<span class="line"><!---->The core issue here is that TabStripModel::MoveTabRelative doesn't check whether a tab is pinned when determining whether it should be added to an adjacent group:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2011;drc=46bbb9795fcc1934c6cfbec096764f888c4d400a<!----></a><br><br>Also, as stated in the summary, the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts are only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros:<span class="line"><!---->Also, as stated in the summary, the Ctrl+Shift+PgUp/Ctrl+Shift+PgDn shortcuts are only supported on Linux and Chrome OS Lacros:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/accelerator_table.cc;l=68-70;drc=8e734c8346bd17a5752fbd4f82f3156d67635edf<!----></a><br><br>So this issue is only relevant on those platforms.<span class="line"><!---->So this issue is only relevant on those platforms.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1210985#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Convert issue to new template structure<h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>
        
          
            Pick a template: <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>
            
              --Please choose a project template--<option value="">--Please choose a project template--</option>
              
                
                   Vpython Wheel Request
                <option value=" Vpython Wheel Request">
                   Vpython Wheel Request
                </option>
                
                  (test)(new) postmortem tracking bug
                <option value="(test)(new) postmortem tracking bug">
                  (test)(new) postmortem tracking bug
                </option>
                
                  Android Issue
                <option value="Android Issue">
                  Android Issue

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
